meanings.definition: A type of amino acid found in proteins.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the prolines in the protein structure.
meanings.sent2: Proteins contain essential prolines for our body's functions.
meanings.sent3: The prolines in the protein party were the life of the amino acid dance.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of prolines was the strong foundation of her understanding of proteins.
meanings.sent5: The prolines acted as the building blocks, holding the protein together.

meanings.sent1: They added extra prolines to the recipe for more flavor.
meanings.sent2: The dish called for two prolines, but they only had one left.
meanings.sent3: The prolines on the plate were having a party, celebrating their plural form.
meanings.sent4: The prolines in the dish stood out like a crowd of amino acids.
meanings.sent5: The prolines were like twins, always together in pairs.
